intro: Galium serpenticum subsp. serpenticum, commonly known as snake's head or serpent's grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale green flowers, which are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitats.
